Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto cruised through five scoreless frames
Evan Phillips, Alex Vesia, Michael Kopech, and Blake Treinen came on in that order, retiring the final 12 hitters they faced
Phillips earned three strikeouts and held the red-hot Fernando Tatis Jr. in check
Michael Kopech absolutely bullied the bottom of that order with his 100+ mph heaters
The Dodgers held San Diego to 24 straight scoreless frames
The Dodgers had the longest scoreless streak to close out a playoff series in the 21st century, and third-longest in the history of the sport
Pre-Game Insights: Dave Roberts said, 'I felt at that time he gave us everything he had and we could give it off to a very, very capable pen.'
Post-Match Reflections: Evan Phillips, Alex Vesia, Michael Kopech, and Blake Treinen were phenomenal, retiring the final 12 hitters they faced
How fitting that one of the more experienced arms in this bullpen, Treinen would get to wrap things off and do so swiftly to avoid any further drama
